title: Young child accidentally shoots 13-month-old sibling in foot
content:
LOGAN — A young child accidentally shot a 13-month-old sibling in the foot with a hunting rifle Monday, Logan police said.
Logan police Capt. Tyson Budge said child, believed to be 4 or 5 years old, got hold of a .30-06 rifle and accidentally shot his sibling. The 13-month old was taken to Primary Children's Hospital. Police were called to the area of 500 North and 500 East just after 9 p.m.
Budge said the 13-month-old's injury is not considered to be life-threatening.
More information will be posted when it becomes available.
